Reviews.Title: “Great way to end our trip”
Reviews.Author: hobocat
Reviews.Content: My wife and her sister and her husband traveled from the US to Scotland. We then traveled to the Netherlands. We flew into the Amsterdam airport. A taxi then took us (10 minute ride) to the Mercure hotel where we had reservations. The hotel was excellent. Great room. Reception was the best. Any questions were answered promptly. People were very nice. Great food. The hotel was located along the Amstel river. It was a short and lovely walk into town. The best way to get around town was by streetcar, It rained all of the time but it was a nice rain. Very beautiful town. We had a great time. Hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but”
Reviews.Author: Davidiboard
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is quiet, comfortable and relaxing. You can access the town via Tram, Train, Bus, Taxis or even walk. Walking is nice in good weather and there are mant routes all very easy but allow 30-40mins. Breakfast is really worth the extra as Amsterdam seems very expensive for just about everything, example Coke Light â‚¬1.70 - â‚¬5 and a bottle of water in the hotel â‚¬7 The rooms are modern, newishand well looked after, its a very clean and proffessional hotel. Getting from the Airport was super easy by train & metro only â‚¬5.50 euro each, beware! a taxis will cost â‚¬40plus. We got a Taxis back from the town it cost â‚¬20 and thats a pretty short trip, the tram or metro only cost â‚¬2.75 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy food and service”
Reviews.Author: Armor-Reisen
Reviews.Content: The room was quite small but okay as well as the breakfast. But what really ruined my stay was the lunch in the bar (the restaurant was taken by a group). At first the service was okay but when I got my pork and was asked if the food was okay I dared to say no. The meat was only a piece of fat, maybe one forth of it was eatable but with a lot of effort to free the meat from the fat. The first service lady asked if she good bring me something else instead, which would have been a good idea. Unfortunately, the other lady refused this and said of course I could order anything else but had to pay. And she gave me a full lecture of how pork had to be. I mean this wasn't the first piece of pork in my life. I hardly touched the meat, but she didn't even offer a free dessert or a coffee. My colleague told me later that she had once the beef burger and it was also awful. So maybe stay in this hotel if you don't mind the location but never, never EAT there. It is a complete waste of money. It would have been easy to satisfy me with something but now this hotel has lost me as a customer totally (I often stay there since our company is nearby, but now never again).

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: gauravm03
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here. Was upgraded to a priviledge room on 7th floor with view of green woods and WTC. Very modern room unlike lot of old hotels in Amsterdam. Breakfast was superb, a lot on offer including several hot items too. Fresh Juice, not very common at all, good coffee too. A little bit far from the city, but there is a metro station 8-10 mins but I didn't bother and took a cab to WTC where I work - 10 mins 15 euros.

Reviews.Title: “standard business hotel with horrible service”
Reviews.Author: DMC476
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Aan de Amstel is a standard business hotel. The usual decor and facilities yet one would be fooled to expect the level of service customary to business hotels. Even though there was no queue it still took 15+ minutes to check in and the guy at reception was incapable of locating my name on my passport page. In the morning the lady at the breakfast area was exceptionally rude, pushing people back and being extremely curt with every visitor, even telling them off. Dont book

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel...”
Reviews.Author: chomperchops
Reviews.Content: This is a good business hotel on the outskirts of Amsterdam. I stayed here with work for 3 days and decided to continue over the weekend for pleasure. As it was a fairly last minute booking there was not much else available at decent prices in the city centre. Having said that, it was absolutely fine for what it was. Room: On arrival I was upgraded to a premier room on the 7th floor. This was fine but the room was quite small and it made me wonder what the standard rooms are like. I did not like the repeat pattern of a 16th century type male on the bathroom door, which gave me nightmares at night - it was also repeated in the corridor outside - my husband also commented that he didn't like it either. Service: I couldn't fault the service at the front desk - they lent several UK / europe adaptors to me as I'd forgotten mine, and also dealt with a rather complicated bill at the end of my stay where I needed to split out all the charges between work and personal credit cards (they had already pre-charged my work card for some reason for the entire stay). Food and beverages: I felt the choice on the room service menu was poor and therefore we chose to eat in the restaurant downstairs at lunch on two days when I was working and in a hurry. I can't fault the burgers - they were huge and fully loaded (probably highly calorific). Location: I noted some people mentioned previously that this hotel is very far away from public transport. This is untrue. It is served by both the trams - take the road to the right, cross over the road bridge and you can get the number 15 into town through the Der Pijp area - and the metro - take the road to the left and take the number 51 into town - which are both about 5 minutes' walk away. Both journeys take about 15 mins into the city centre. Clearly you're not going to stay here if you can stay in town - but it was fine for what we needed. The only thing I missed was being able to come back late afternoon to freshen up and change for dinner, but it wasn't a major problem. You can also get taxis to and from the centre for about 15-20 euros. The hotel can also arrange a pre-paid taxi voucher for 33 euros to the airport, which is a lot cheaper than the the 52 euros I was charged on the way from the airport to the hotel. All in all, if you're there on business, I would recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Free Lunch*”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy E
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at the Mercure Hotel Amsterdam. It was generally a positive experience with clean well-designed rooms, free wifi and friendly staff. However, there were a few exceptions. The hotel is located quite a distance from the city center and transit does not run very late even on weekends. A taxi costs about 25 Euros each way and this adds up quickly. Additionally, the second floor smelled like cigarette smoke and the business center had only two computers in it (one missing a mouse), and each â€œfreeâ€� breakfast advertised in the lobby came with a surprise *22.5 Euro charge revealed upon checkout. Make sure you do you research before you book a stay at Mercure Hotel Amsterdam Aan de Amstel.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard despite the high price”
Reviews.Author: jude9999
Reviews.Content: Fuss free check-in. Well maintained room. Wireless internet is handy. Quietness is achievable. Detail is appreciated such as multi-language printed languages on notes and toiletries. I was just slightly surprised of the small room and only shower (no bath) against the price. Breakfast buffet is rather average.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location, unsatisfactory service”
Reviews.Author: JoanThessaloniki
Reviews.Content: The worst thing about the hotel is its location. Apart from being far from city centre, distance to the nearest metro or tram station was 10 minutes walk. The rooms were very clean and seemed to be newly furnished but they were small. The thing that annoyed us the most was when we asked for a pair of slippers they first said that they didn't have and afterwards the hotel manager found two pairs but charged them for 3.50euro per pair!

Reviews.Title: “" Just great"”
Reviews.Author: Anna E
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were in this hotel for a 4 day trip in Amsterdam (my travel agency booked it). Manouk de Witte, who is responsible for the Bookings, was really very helpfull giving us all important information requeried. I got every single mail answered before we arrived. The rooms are very clean, big and confortable . Room 3018 wonderfull panorama!! the breakfast buffett (was included in our hotel package), was just "great", such a variation of food!!!. The staff was very friendly, specially in the small restaurant in the evenings. The prices are not expensive because the portions are really big, so you can share with your partner. The hotel is only about 10/15 minutes to walk to the Tram station (Overamsel), from there you are in only 10 minutes in Centraal Station. Just watch out: you have to go on top of the bridge when you leave Overamsel station,( fisrt you go under the bridge to get out of the station, and then you have to "go on top of the bridge"), to get to the hotel. You canÂ´t reach the hotel if you go under the bridge. Thank you very much to all the staff from Mercure Hotel, we had a great time in Amsterdam and defentely recomend this hotel . We will come again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - very poor gym equipment”
Reviews.Author: happiness1973
Reviews.Content: I stay here for business and really like a good work out when travelling. The Mecure advertise a gym at this hotel however it consists of 3 pieces of equipment - a broken rowing machine, a bike and a cross trainer... all which seem at least 10 years old. There are some hand weights but nothing that i would call a gym as such. They really need to upgrade their equipment as its dodgy and someone is bound to hurt themselves one day. Saying all of that, the hotel itself is nice and the bed comfortable. Not a central location so would not choose this if coming on holidays to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: yuhia m
Reviews.Content: we have been in december for 3 nights in this hotel and i can only say,very good.The room was big enough,the bathroom was great and very clean,the breakfast was very good and we hade many choises,from chees til sausages,fresh juice everythink you like.We was very satisfied with this hotel. You can park in the parks of the hotel for 20 euro day or you can park outside and pay the automat,i the weekend very cheap to park. when you want to the city i recommed to take the train where is around 500meter from the hotel. to take the car to the city is not wise. You have many restaurant near the hotel,you can walk 10 minutes and you will see many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend In Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Owenclayton
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel , fantastic food , fantastic people . we arrived in amsterdam @ 12.30 pm . After a short walk through the airport, We followed the directions given as we payed for a taxi transfer ,( At Â£99.oo i thought a little exspensive ) but when we got in to the car it was well worth it ! a merc 500 AMG !!!!!! just for me and my wife, tip top time keeping ! and the return trip back from the hotel . the location of the hotel is fantastic !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! right on the river . 10 min walk to the tram station, no waiting ! they run like clockwork. the food and the staff were fantastic , we stayed two nights and check-out was 12.00 , we were able to leave our case and passports in the hotel ( in a secure room ) next to reception , so we were able to spend another full day in the city without our cases , and unlike the u.k. or greece !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! it did not cost a penny !!! well done Mercure , a fantstic hotel keep up the good work .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Lana J
Reviews.Content: This hotel was SUPER! my friend and I went to Amsterdam for a weekend (flew in from UK) and decided to stay here and the experience surpassed all expectations! Absolutely amazing service from the moment we arrived til the time we left. Our room was lovely, the bathroom was in excellent condition, the general look and feel of the reception was very clean and welcoming and most importantly, the staff was very warm and extremely professional in their interactions with us. I would recommend this hotel to ANYONE - business or leisure travelers should stay here!!! Lana Jones, Barbados

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ã�„ã‚“ã�¦ã‚Šã‚„ã��ã�–
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel last winter. It was very cold. But this hotel is very comfortable for me. Wide bed, clean room, good atmosphere. I didn't have breakfast but dinner was good taste.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for a short business stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed M
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fantastic and the staff are friendly. the only problem is its location on the city border. if you don't have a car, you can't stay till late night in Amsterdam city center as you will always think about your transportation back to the hotel and the long walk (10-15 min) in a dark pedestrian sideway on the highway. also, a long walk to the congress center (20-25 min). i would go next time to a lower class hotel in city center where i can enjoy my time till late night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business style hotel”
Reviews.Author: glostaff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst attending a conference at the nearby conference centre. Room was very clean, bathroom nice. Didn't eat here but had a few drinks before going down to Amsterdam centre. Service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel near Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Gill M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for new year's eve for two nights. It was quite busy on arrival but thanks to my a club gold card someone from the back office came and checked us in. The hotel is kept clean and is a typical Accor hotel including free wifi throughout the hotel, even in the rooms! The hotel consists of two towers where I think one tower has more modern rooms then the other one but I'm not sure of this. As we never had breakfast I can not judge on this we did however have the NYE buffet at 20 euro which included a glass of mediocre cava but the food itself is something I would not write home about. You can park for free in front of the hotel if you can find a spot or pay 20 euro/night for the hotel's parking. If you want to get to the city you will rely on taxi's as public transport is very difficult here which is a downside as a taxi will cost 25 euro easily one way. If you're a party of 5 then it's ok. The gym is small, dumbless upto 10 kg. Sauna and steam bath are old but clean. The rooms are reasonably modern and include all amenities. In terms of the size you can say it's up to standard and if you're two in a double room it's definately ok! Some downsides? - No complimentary bottle of water in our room (I've had it in every other hotel) - Overpriced minibar - Breakfast is very expensive over 20 euro Overall you will not regret staying in this hotel and you can expect a good service as usual from Accor!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern very clean and a has a calm pleasent atmosphere.Rooms were of a good size and quality.Only ten minutes from the RAI where we were working and about 15 minutes into the city centre.Taxis readily available and its a nice walk to the RAI if you fancy it.Good value with the movie channels at only 5.95 euro.Breakfast was good but expensive if you dont get it within your room rate but theres not much near by for a cheaper breakfast.My only complaint was after booking online and paying in full which i do all the time for business when checking out it wasnt on their system that i was prepaid.Although having print off of my reservation and using the offical accor booking site i was forced to pay again but if when i get back to the UK and i can prove i have paid twice they would refund me.Even though i had already seen my visa bill from October when i first booked the hotel there was no movement or an offer of further investigation to head office to check my payment.Now back in the UK with all my visa statements and trying to sort my refund out!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for business”
Reviews.Author: FCWaregem
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in this hotel and found it to be very good. I needed to be in Amsterdam for business reasons and found this hotel to be very good. Check in was smooth and the rooms are practical and clean as you would expect from a Mercure hotel. I had a room on the 14th floor and with only 2 elevators, I found it very annoying that the average waiting time for the lift was at least 3 minutes... But then again, this is only a small comment. Breakfast and lunch are ok in this hotel, however it still is Dutch cuisine. but all by all ok. The hotel is a 10 min taxi drive (15 euro) away from city center and has public transport nearby. If I have the chance, I will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean but very small. However, they have everything you need and good bedding. The hotel restaurant menu is very limited and service is slow. In the evening meals have to be taken at the bar. Conveniently located for trade shows

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Aan de Amstel was perfect for us. Parking there was not expensive and close to public transportation to get into the city. For those who are new to Amsterdam, I would not recommend it because it is out of the way and can be intimating to find. The room was nice and relatively clean (few hairs we found in the bathroom that were not our own) and the staff was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend out”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a party in the neighborhood of the hotel. Not so good: - price, I think â‚¬125/night is a bit too much for a room with a bed, tv and shower - parking at â‚¬20/day when public parking is â‚¬15 for 9am-9pm and nights/weekends free - breakfast at â‚¬21.50 p.p. is outrageous Undecided: o the sauna/steambath; it had to be switched on and wasn't exactly inviting but on the other hand it was doing its job and there was no additional fee Good: + clean and comfy room (coffee/tea maker, bottle of water incl) + no complaints about the staff/service + nice shower

Reviews.Title: “Just a few points left to get 100%...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have spent in this hotel maybe 2 months of my life altogether, so this was definitely not my first stay (it was 14 days this time). I must say that I like this hotel very much. Plus I got upgrade to Privilege room as a Platinum Business Favorite Guest, which I definitely did appreciate. Here are some notes: PROS: - fantastic breakfast - best I had in Amsterdam. Only thing I did not like were smashed eggs, otherwise it is very rich variety of food, including fresh juice. - very clean rooms - free and very good wifi - I love rain-shower in Privilege room - free fitness/sauna (which I did not use unfortunately) - hotel parking is for 20 EUR, however there are plenty of public parking places in front of the hotel, which are free 19-9 and during weekends and only for 0.10 EUR/hour during a day. - very calm, when widow is closed - tea/coffee maker for free - overall sufficient room for a good comfort - mini-bar CONS: - cleaning service is the main concern, which I would like to improve. It is very good in basic things (i.e. cleaning of the room), but sometimes I did not get my cups cleaned, I did not get new tea etc. Not really horrible, but not nice after hard-working day... - mini-bar is automatically charged. However you can put your things on one side and say that you did not use anything at the end. There is still some space for your own things. But this is really not convenient for me (even if they promote it this way). - sometimes there are only 2 people at the reception for bunch of people - location is not good for people, who wish to be in a center a lot. However I was working not far from the hotel and I had my car, so this was perfect location for me. - no automatic air-conditioning. There is radiator under the window, so switch it on, if room is too cold for you.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: LondonSunGod Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located away from the busy night life and is located by the business sector. It's located around 15 mins in a taxi from the airport and on the banks of the Amstel River. It's modern and clean and this services are great from business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient for a business stay”
Reviews.Author: Transco
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an efficient business hotel just outside Amsterdam, this hotel offers very good value. It is conveniently located close to the highway with a large parking (that you have to pay extra) and just a short taxi ride from the centre. Overall offers comparable standards in terms of comfort and breakfast quality as other Mercure hotels. If you have a choice book the "Privilege" rooms that are slightly more expensive but recently refurbished and offer much better comfort that the standard ones.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night 27th October in room 3020 after a restless night sleep I woke to find I was covered in bed bug bites along my arms and legs and additional bites from a creature i am unable to identify. all in all a very uncomfortable and unpleasant stay. I regularly stay in Mercure chain of hotels and this experience has put me of staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experiences”
Reviews.Author: LondonThelma
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is Franka on the reception desk who is wonderful, efficient and friendly. Had to down grade to get a full bath - which is ridiculous.. Like so many hotels it does not cater for businesswomen, but everything asked for was provided. Basic room was spacious and comfortable. Food limited and restaurant not open in the evening. Also quite far out of city centre.

Reviews.Title: “careful to book online”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: had to pay additional room when booked online to accomodate for 3 adults + 1 infant in 1 room...too far from city center..no free parking..far from restaurants, store, etc.. be careful booking online, hotel will not change any reservations done online, handled by separate company. you can only cancel with no refund...

Reviews.Title: “Good business lodging especially for RAI Conventioneers”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug1155
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days on a business trip. The hotel was within a 10 min walk of Over Amstel tram station. Two towers, both very modern the room have all the ecoutrements wireless and cabled internet , free bottled water , robes, full bath accessories with lufa sponges etc. 4 types of lighting in the room, flat screen tvs, good bedding and pillows ample storage and very quiet inside. Excercise room, Full sauna, sun /tan room, steam room , but I could not figure out how to actually use these. and only had a short time to indulge any way. If you need to be out near the RAI this is great choice. pricing between 150 - 170 euros seems reasonable, for a business class hotel. It jumps to 250 euros during events I saw, unless you had some discounts. You are a 6 euro cab ride to the RAI or one tram stop away if you walk to the station. They have a fantastic breakfast every morning anything you might ask for except custom prepared omlettes and other to order items. The buffet was fresh and the auto coffee/cappuchino machines worked beautifully along with the fresh squeezed OJ and all the other fixings- probably the best hotel buffet breakfast I have seen. It's a bit steep by US standards but for 21 euros, if you like breakfast it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel with a 1 star service”
Reviews.Author: chunl
Reviews.Content: Very bad customer service, problems from the moment we stepped into the hotel. During our two night stay we had to change room three times and this is least of the concern from this hotel from hell. Here are the hightlight Asked for twin beds and gave us double beds. (Checked and advised by two member of staff) Hotel staff lied to us that our twin beds would be available after during the evening but in fact they claimed were fully booked and was refusing to to rellocate our rooms when we re-checked during the evening Made a complaint to the manager and he offered us room with a double bed and a sofa bed instead. For a Â£100 per night i wasnt impressed at all to sleep on a sofa bed. No beddings on the sofa bed and and it took 1.5 hours and three phone chasers for the hotel staff to make the bedding. (This was 12am at night and call backs were promised and not fulfilled) No duvet for the sofa bed because they claimed there were fully booked and gave us bed sheets as a duvet. 'I do not expect to pay Â£100 per night to sleep on a sofa bed and us bed sheets as duvet in a four star hotel.' Next morning the duty manager offer us one of the following as a compensating and you can make up your mind whether they were sincere or not Free Taxi ride to the airport, which is only 20 mins by car, or free burger and chips lunch, or another night to stay at the Mecure, but after this bad experience there is no way i would recommend this hotel to anyone in the end we refused all of the offers because we believe they were not very sincere and the compensation was an insult.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: epiccinelli
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, in a quite area of Amsterdam; public transportation is available at walking distance (metro #50 and tram #25) and RAI exibition center is near by (about 15 minutes walk). Rooms are comfortable (not very easy to manage the air cooling, btw) with internet WiFi connection available. Breakfast buffet is really enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Entym
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night whilst on business. Although the rooms are a little compact they do offer all the facilities you would expect from a business class hotel. Bedroom and bathroom were extremely clean along with all other public areas I visited.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Amstel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good business hotel, staff very good hotel is clean and tidy and not far from transport to the city. Food in bar is very good, however, the buffet breakfast is a bit of a shambles.....hot food.....every dish was either cold or luke warm even the food brought from the kitchen was only just warm....not good when you consider how much breakfast is, the staff seemed oblivious when asked the question why the food was cold or just warm....other issue is of course is heath, when food should be ho it should be hot not cold, this is asking for problems, my advice stick to the cold food that is supposed to be cold and steer away from the hot meals as i ended having to do.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy room”
Reviews.Author: sara123
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable mattress, Basic toiletries but not the best quality and the shampoo totally dried my hair out- no conditioner either! Tea and coffee in the room with kettle. Great breakfast- anything you want was there and I really enjoyed it. Really comfortable stay and overall I was very pleased with it. The only thing I would mention is the location- it is a 5 min walk to the tram station, and importantly, it is not signposted from the train station. We walked up the road only to find that the canal had no crossing and so we had to walk all the way back to the train station, to cross the canal and then make our way up to the hotel again. It would be nice if there was a shuttle service from the main local train station, not only from schipol station.

Reviews.Title: “My first choice in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Retrotecchie
Reviews.Content: An excellent business-class hotel and considering the fact that Amsterdam is a VERY expensive place, not too bad price-wise. Located in the more 'industrial' outskirts of Amsterdam at the junction of the A4 and A10 so convenient for commuting around Holland. Ten minutes drive into the City, but walk 500 metres up the road and hop a tram if you want to get around cheaply and quickly. My colleague and I paid a little extra (â‚¬30) to upgrade to the Premium rooms and also made use of the excellent business lounge/cafe area. â‚¬7.50 and hour which includes desk-space with cabled internet (although the free wifi is also excellent) and complimentary tea, coffee, cakes and juices included in the hourly charge. We spend four hours in the lounge after checking out, which they added to our bill before we paid so we didn't need to mess about with separate bills. They also only charged us for two hours instead of the four as we were guests. Room quality was first class. Well appointed, nicely stocked bathroom with all the 'goodies' and Premier guests get slippers, a fluffy bathrobe and a litre of mineral water on top of the usual room facilities. If the weather is nice, as it was on our trip, its worth dragging the laptop out to the terrace behind the business lounge and enjoy the fresh air by the side of the canal. Wifi signal is excellent in the terrace area. Breakfast in the restaurant was very good, with a huge selection of Continental items as well as cooked food. Service generally was very good, and the staff on the front desk and in the lounge areas were very polite, friendly and helpful. Yes, you can get a B&B or pension in Amsterdam for a lot less money if you are travelling 'on your own dime', but if you are looking for a quality 'business class' hotel, you won't go far wrong with the Mercure.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel breakfast and car parking rather expensive”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very good, nice, clean modern rooms. Close to tram and train station. Easy to get into Amsterdam city centre. 21 euro for breakfast and 20 euros car parking per day is rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: GotLaptopWillTravel
Reviews.Content: Did not use it as a base to see Amsterdam but just as a place to sleep and eat, no real comment about the location. The place itself looks very modern and the staff is friendly and accommodating. Good menu in the restaurent if you stay just 2-3 days, for longer periods you might want to venture out into town for a change. Room was just great, very spacious and an excellent shower which isn't something you can depend on with Mercures in general! Will visit again when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelling33 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was nice and clean. Staff were helpful although it took a while to get served at check-in due to how busy the hotel was. The room rate was reasonable and the hotel was promoting a communications package which allowed for reasonably priced internet access using the in-room tv. Wifi internet was free. Location was ok. It took a while to get into Amsterdam city although there were convenient public transport options.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i will not go to anyother place when travelling to Amsterdam...... it was worth staying there with all the possible amenities. Location is awesome, service is marvellous and the food is outstanding. There is no negativity i found in this stay at mercure

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, average service”
Reviews.Author: Mickdooms
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy to access city centre and airport alike. Nice modern rooms and decent breakfast service. However service was poor -was given an occupied room and woke up a poor old lady who was fast asleep when I walked in. Failed to get an iron delivered to my room after asking and my 'privilege' room was identical to a standard room. Needs better management it seems.

Reviews.Title: “Could not handle the heat”
Reviews.Author: shandydog
Reviews.Content: Stay here during a heat wave in Amsterdam and the pretty new hotel was able to keep the rooms cool. Very unpleasant trying to sleep and the hotel staff did not seem to care.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient and Nice Business Hotel - 2 Minutes Drive to RAI”
Reviews.Author: 3breathed
Reviews.Content: Pros: I was very pleased with the hotel, I had a privilege room on the 7th floor. The Room Service was good. Room was clean, functional and super quit. The Service was excellent! They were very helpful and very friendly. Cons: Parking is relatively expensive. I was there for 1 1/2 day and paid 40 Euros - and this hotel is in a business area so I do not quite understand why it has to be that expensive. Though I get reimbursed for that still bothers me a little. Internet Wlan was free with my privilege room, and was easily accessible, but really slow!! Sufficient to get text-based emails, but to access a company server - no chance! But these two points were not this problematic to me. Conclusion: Will come again next time I have business in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible expense from Mercure for the first time”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On the internet it says that it has AC (air Con) but in reality the rooms are boiling hot and to my surprise they didn't even had a Fan when i asked them. The staffs were very rude and was not willing to help at all. I didn't like that hotel at all and if they could have refund me i would appreciate. Will never advice anyone to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is excellent, location is poor for access to Amsterdam and nothing is in the vicinity. Ideal for arrival by car. Room service efficient, restaurant good for Holland. Car parking expensive but free spaces available over night.

Reviews.Title: “No way”
Reviews.Author: Mertsi
Reviews.Content: Service in the hotel was poor. Employeers are too young and green. They are irresponsibles. The rooms at the lower side are small and the beds ar narrow. Better side is the new one. The hotel situation are at the storage area. Never go there again! Eveyone must paid some Amsterdam taxes when you are leaving from the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Great facility - be sure that it is close to where you need to be though!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked well for my visit. It is a 7 minute walk to the Metro or 10 minutes to the tram. The hotel restaurant is great - I'd recommend that breakfast package. There no nearby shops or restaurants choices within walking distance. Room was quite and comfortable and staff attentive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good but a little "distant"”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but as a person dependant on public travel - and a bad walker, it seemed so far away when I arrived to Overamstel station. Being a latecomer I was received in a very friendly manner by the night-duty personnel at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Not great.”
Reviews.Author: SMH100
Reviews.Content: Expensive for where it is. Got "Superior" room which was extremely small with no bath , only shower. Air conditioning not effective and had to leave window open all night. No thermostat for temperature settings, it was simply either on or off. Good buffet breakfast. Not great and won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “atmosphere,laid back”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First I would like to congratulate the staff for their splendid service and consideration We received. The rooms were clean and serviced every day. The metro is ideal for getting to central staion,10 mins,most of essential trams stop there.The 2&5 will take you to the museum i.e. Rembrant. Oh the breakfasts exellent..It was the icing on cake for a very enjoyable stay in our fav City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel , Pricy Though !”
Reviews.Author: BlueHedgehog Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is equipped with large rooms and excellent in room facilities. It's a pricy choice and considering its location in suburbs of Amsterdam, it brings down the value for money a bit. But overall I had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Total shock”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I tried to cancel this since I could not stay at your hotel for , i am completely disappointed that you have not honored my request for a cancellation. I think you owe me an explanation as a potential customer in the future

Reviews.Title: “Great out of town hotel”
Reviews.Author: Si_uk_says
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a broker and got a hugely discounted rate. Standard double room was completed to a high standard with the most comfy bed (we struggled to get up in the mornings!') Bathroom was nice if a little small, but sunshine shower made up for that. Mini bar expensive but expected, there are no nearby shops. Hotel staff very pleasant and helpful. Sauna and steam room an added bonus but you will have to ask them to switch them on for you, so phone down in advance or use the gym whilst your waiting. When we travelled the metro tunnel was closed so we took the metro one stop and changed for a tram, which took max 30mins into the city centre. Normally the metro goes direct to the central station.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MelissaDarryn
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with a tour group, I thought the hotel was very clean and tidy. Very comfortable beds with great breakfast provided. Staff were great very helpful wonderful man served us in the little shop in the morning before we left again. The only thing I would say is it is a bit out of town, this would be my only concern. But everything else was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: madhuvan
Reviews.Content: Good service in the reception, Excellent rooms, Ideal location, close to overamstel train station. 10 minutes drive to city centre. 24 hrs taxi service available in front of hotel. close to airport & central rail station. Staff cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Upset and VERY VERY DISAPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: Kmab245
Reviews.Content: To start I arrived to Hotel Mercure and they could not find my reservations. I made reservations a month out and paid for my room online and money came out my account on the day I made the reservation. then I get to the hotel and they can't find my reservation so I am charged again for my room when I check in, money is again taken out my account. I check in stay my one night only to check out and be charged again for this same room. Now I have paid three times for one night stay in this hotel. I went to the clerk and asked for the manager who tells me their is nothin she can do. By this time I am running late to get back to the airport to which they have NO free Shuttle as stated on the site I booked this hotel from To and from I have to pay to get to and from. I was upset because one of my account has been drained of funds by your hotel. I was very very disappointed in the Hotel service. My reservations was made on the internet thur Accorhotels.com reservation prepaid 138.00 EUR THAT INCLUDED ROOM AND BEAKFAST. I have never had such a mess when at a hotel in my life. this stay was very disappointing. Really need to be credited back my money for this room. I stayed one night not three and should have never been charged the extra charges I was charged for my room. I have informed my bank to the unauthoizered charges as well. This hotel ran my credit card ten times. I have never had this happen before. I am Dissapointed in my stay with your Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Feedback to Mercure Hotel Amsterdam Aan de Amstel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've been recommended your hotel by my collegues in the Netherlands.I enjoyed my stay, and think I'll be back next time I'm on business trip in Holand. It seems nice and quired.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean and comfortable. Staff make you feel very welcome without being overally formal. Has a lovely traditional bar with friendly staff which is a great place for a drink after your day out. Bit of a distance to Amsterdam centre but only a 5-10 min walk to the tram then an easy journey in. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, out of town but very accessible.”
Reviews.Author: LesHrx Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and facilities, staff are particularly helpful. A good location, easy to find at the end of the A2, secure parking, and close to Metro and trams if you don't want to drive around town.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing New Year Break”
Reviews.Author: roastpotato
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the New Year weekend and was pleasantly surprised after reading some of the reviews here. First off, reception staff were polite and so helpful, for us English speakers spoke excellent English. The bar/restaurant staff were very friendly and attentive, the menu was limited but the food was very high quality, hot & fresh and appetising. The rooms are very clean the bed is enormous & very comfortable with proper fluffy pillows. The shower is over the bath its adequate not brilliant. The hotel is outside Amsterdam Centre {was told it was 2 kilometres} but it was easy to get to the centre by public transport. If you went left outside the hotel and walked about 7 minutes you came to the Overamstel metro station. Trains are every 10 mins. (including Sunday) and the journey is just 10 mins on train no.51 to Central Station which is opposite the Dam Rak. (Coming back you need train 51 destination Westwijk) Downside is that the station is automated so you need to read all the signs carefully to make sure you get on the right train and use the ticket machine. If you went right outside hotel & walked about 7 mins. over the bridge there were trams that went to centre of Amsterdam, we did not use this so cannot comment on it but was told it was easy and took about 30 minutes to Amsterdam Centre. We went to Schipol Airport on the metro train from Overamstel to Amsterdam Central & then train to the airport whole trip only took 40 minutes and cost about quarter of the 45 euros the taxi cost us when we arrived. (Taxi took about 20 mins.) As this hotel was outside the centre it was quiet at night enabling good nights sleep. Loved our stay here & will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosario_it
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Amstel and so not in the centre but there is the metro at about 10 minutes walking. Moreover, if you arrive/leave with Eurolines the location can be advantageous. The hotel itself is modern and efficient. The breakfast is very good with a lot of choice. If you don't care travelling when visiting Amsterdam this is a good solution. The hotels in the centre are usually very expensive and with a low quality.

Reviews.Title: “Waiting for an empty breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for many years. This time, the perenial elavator problems became more troublesome. Due to heavy booking of large tour groups, the elevators at 7:30 to 8:30 AM were averaging 10 minutes. Breakfast buffet was always out of inventory for major items as staff could not replenish timely and there was a hunt and wait for a table for one/two. Unless they abandon the booking of large groups, I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very average business hotel with added tour groups”
Reviews.Author: sheiling
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an uninteresting business suburb of Amsterdam. I arrived just after a coach party of oriental tourists. With only two receptionists there was quite a delay checking in. The immediate impression of the reception area was functional, crowded, chaotic and untidy. Extra charged for Wi-Fi. The hotel is based on 2 towers with 2 lifts servicing each. Only one lift was working in the tower where my room was located. Not only was the remaining lift small and slow, I had to wait for the coach party to get up first. I waited approx 30 mins for a lift to access my room - I didn't fancy carrying my suitcase by stairway to the 12th floor. Room was clean, quiet and comfortable if uninteresting. No mobile phone reception in the room. The Bar is open to the reception area, so suffers from the same railway station concourse atmosphere. Breakfast selection was good, but again was competing with a large coach party to get to the buffet. Room rate of â‚¬140 per night, not including Breakfast or Wi-Fi, was very poor value. Would have been quite satisfied at câ‚¬80

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing experience”
Reviews.Author: BrianWiggings
Reviews.Content: We went to a congress in Amsterdam and as so many times, you think you've seen it all in these big hotels. So, big was my surprise when I noticed one part of this hotel was recently renovated with a more contemporary style: flashy paintings from the famous Dutch sailor Piet Heijn, in a Andy Warhol lookalike style, modern furniture and an excellent rainshower in the bathroom. The bar of the hotel is quite crowded in the evening, but after all it's a good atmosphere. Breakfast is perfect, but if you can...don't go to early in the morning. If not, you risk to be squeezed with Japanese sight-seeing tourists ;.)

Reviews.Title: “nice and comfortable, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tannythestar
Reviews.Content: well equipped, spacious room. good spread of breakfast. wifi was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - beautiful sunset”
Reviews.Author: Beave8920
Reviews.Content: We stayed one nite as part of a tour group. This hotel is newer and in great shape - our accomidations were very comfortable. The rooms were clean and of a nice size. We were on the 15th floor and watched a beautiful sunset from our room. There was a resturant and bar in the lobby and both were good. This hotel is a bit out of the downtown area, but the bus/train stops are close by.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jean0815
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Aan de Amstel is a roomy, comfortable Hotel - if it would just be located closer to the city instead of being surrounded by highways, train lines and industrial/commercial areas (might be convenient for drivers, for users of public transport not so much). However, the hotel itself can be recommended. Even though it is huge, the service is good and lobby, restaurant etc. feel quite cosy.

Reviews.Title: “Outside the city but great hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussiecouple45
Reviews.Content: Yes this city is a bit outside the centre of Amsterdamn but it was only a 10 minutes walk to the station and 10 minutes train trip in and they run every 5 minutes so no biggie for us. We had a room upgrade after we complained because they tried to give us 2 single beds as we had made a request and not a reservation. I told her that i had paid over 3 months ago and we weren't leaving until we got our double bed. She tried to charge us an extra 30euro a night. Everything got fixed but not after I cracked it big time. Our room was nice and clean. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern hotel BUT far from city centre”
Reviews.Author: Fred_Hill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of a Trafalgar tour. The hotel itself is quite nice and modern but quite a way from the city centre. Despite what other people have said, there is a tram station very close by (just over the bridge) which takes you into the centre. The only annoying thing is the lack of elevators for a htoel of this size, they need more (I guess only impacts you if your travelling in groups - or are checking it at the same time as a group). I would recommed somewhere closer to the centre but it is still a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Accurately rated as a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: ptitefunambule
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel (1 night) during a tour of Europe, Traditional Europe, organized by Trafalgar. We travelled as a group and I always shared a room with my boyfriend. We had a spacious room that was nice and modern. We were actually lucky enough to get a king size bed. The buffet breakfast was excellent. Clean and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Riverview hotel in quiet and cosy Amstel region w/o satisfactory room service”
Reviews.Author: rajkul
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something quiet and away from hustle bustle of the city life, this one fits perfectly. However it is little far from central part of Amsterdam where in lies the heart of the city with all the nightlife and cafes and people. In case you want to get a real taste of Amsterdam and get the cultural experience I would advice against this hotel and rather move into one near the central region. However this one also lacks in room service area so if you are business traveler, you might want to explore some other place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JazzyKent
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 night stay in Amserdam. The only real thing to complain about was the distance from the city. The hotel is a bit out of town and does overlook an industrial area at the back as other revier's have said. Taxi's are very expensive. It cost us 40 euros from the airport to the hotel. We ended up buying a 48 hour bus travel card for 11.5 euros each and the bus service is very good. It is about a 5 - 7 minute walk to the bus stop. The buses run regularly and are very clean. Our hotel room was on 5th floor and was clean and modern. Breakfast was good with a good continental selection of hot and cold food. Bar staff were friendly as were reception staff. If this hotel was put nearer to the hotel we would go again, but it was just a little bit too far out for us but overall we enjoyed our first stay in Amserdam

Reviews.Title: “Mercure AAN DE Amstel Good Hotel Strange Elevator System”
Reviews.Author: ldenker
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, elevator had a complicated system where you needed to use your room card and to be of a certain weight to ride the elevator. Good food, nice restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: KlimtEastwood
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights on a work-related trip in late June. The hotel and the rooms are clean, and although the rooms are a bit small (very little shelf storage, no drawers), everything works fine and the shower (no bath) was very good. The staff were very helpful. The not-so-good facts about the hotel are 1) it's quite a way out of town (25mins on the tram to A'dam Central from Kennedyplein; 10mins on metro from Overamstel); 2) it may technically be 'on the Amstel', but it's a side-canal of the Amstel which separates the hotel from an industrial park (and a prison, apparently); 3) there is *nothing* in the near vicinity: it's a bit of an urban desert, and you have to walk 10 minutes over the bridge to get to facilities like cafes, bakeries, etc.; that wouldn't be so bad if the in-hotel facilities were reasonably priced, but at â‚¬18 for a caesar salad and â‚¬25 for breakfast, hanging around it a pricey option; 4) the 'fitness suite' is a pretty small room with one bike, one cross-trainer, a mat, a bench and...wait for it: a table football / fuzeball table! (also, there's no disinfectant to wipe machines with after use, so...yuck!); and finally 5) the air conditioning had a barely noticeable effect in the room, which given the very hot and muggy weather was not very pleasant. The hotel has internet, but it is a) wired (bring your own cable or pay â‚¬5 for one) and b) expensive, at â‚¬10 per day. Bottom line: nothing badly wrong with the hotel, but for the same price you can get a room much closer to the city centre where you can soak up the atmosphere more easily.

Reviews.Title: “Very good. Almost love it”
Reviews.Author: La_gunaDanmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Nice and fast check in. Got a nice room in the new Piet Hein tower. We stayed on the 11th floor. Nice, but not so large room. Big twin bad. Everything was perfect, nice amenities and the best shower, with a giant showerhead in the ceiling. Breakfast was good, with everything you need in the morning. They have an enclosed parking area, that costs 20 euro pr night, (but we ended up paying only 20 euro for 3 nights) or you can park your car , right in front of the hotel, but there are only place for 25-30 cars. We also used the bar/restaurant in the hotel. They have a very nice menu and great food, but it took about 30 minutes to get the bill (they were very busy) It takes about 5 min ( 500m) to the Overamstel Metro station. Very nice stay, will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really not friendly reception”
Reviews.Author: pauline1018
Reviews.Content: The preface is we stock in Amsterdam due to airport shutdown and reserve this hotel urgently. Reception is not friendly or any patient to listen or answer customer question. When group leader ask about any possibility to have breakfast not by group, but by individual. Reception had hand on the waist and directly answered....you should be satisfied you have hotel to live......instead of any communication way. When I ask if there is any bus or tram schedule available in the reception. The answer is only "No,"and I found it at last in the information table. Personal feeling is...can't endure any cold attitude further and think this would be the worst experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Food - Horrible location”
Reviews.Author: VanninLady
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although on the river, is situated in the middle of an industrial estate, there is nowhere in close proximity to walk to or restaurants to go and eat at. The room was overheated, and the air conditioning didn't work; leaving the window open was too noisy as it's only 300 yds from a main busy road. They have one of these ridiculous lifts that you have to put your room card in to selected the floor, and it wasn't working properly at the time! There were coach loads of far eastern tourists, yes it was cheap but this is not a good place to stay for the delights of Amsterdam. The saving grace was that the restaurant was very good. I left the breakfast card on my door at 10:00pm but it wasn't collected - so do check if you try the same!

Reviews.Title: “Good location outside of the rush in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MaharajTrekker
Reviews.Content: Service was not the best - room had 2 single beds and enquiry about changing the room to one with a double bed, I got a rather cold response that they had not available. Did not seem that the young man at Reception even looked up any available rooms. Room was otherwise very clean and comfortable. Location is a bit away from main tourist attractions - took a cab back from the city centre which cost about 20 Euros. Breakfast was the only one where we had a great feast compared to elsewhere in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: MishyBear
Reviews.Content: Mercure Hotel â€“ Amsterdam Completely out of the city centre this hotel has had a very modern funky renovation in the rooms, we stayed in room 5014, it had bright colours and decor, a large double bed comfy pillows and flat screen TV. Also the room temperature was optimal. It had a good bathroom although no bath and average bath products it did have a proper hair dryer, the shower( when I worked it out) was great with the choice of either a normal shower head, or a big overhead shower head which felt like large rain drops. The breakfast menu was nice, good bacon, eggs & hash browns but also lovely freshly squeezed orange juice. They also have various snacks in packets e.g. crisp breads etc that are handy to pocket to eat later in the day. Out of all the hotels I stayed in during the Trafalgar tour this was one of the best, definitely recommend Mercure hotels over Hiltons room at the at the lower budget end.

Reviews.Title: “New yr eve stay”
Reviews.Author: Elainie32
Reviews.Content: I am totally in the middle as I liked the fact we were in a clean, quiet location but found it boring as I loved the central station part and would come back a bit to loud for the hotel surranding. I read reviews before I went that the hotel was miles from the metro but infact it was a 5 min walk maybe not that far. It is very expensive to eat with not alot of choice but to be fair everywhere is over priced for food & drink. It tends to be women working during the day that are very helpful and make you feel welcomed and men working at night that don't.. Overall I did l enjoy my stay and felt safe and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and not too far to Central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: KerryNetherlands
Reviews.Content: The room was modern and VERY clean. We paid 85EUR for a Saturday night as we were attending a concert at the Heineken Music Hall. Worth it. The restaurant was also very decent.

Reviews.Title: “Surpringly good”
Reviews.Author: EurofilesfromBeds
Reviews.Content: After making the booking we read some reviews on tripadvisor and thought the out of town location was going to be a problem - not at all. The twenty minute tram ride into town gave us opportunities to have a close up view of everyday life in amsterdam. The hotel was excellent in everyway except one - the exhorbitant breakfast price. QWe should have booked the appropriate package. asides from this excellent room facilities, first class staff, love reasturant food the best meal we had in amsterdam actually. The bar was a very sociable setting which we enjoyed very much and even the drinks prices were reasonable by hotel standards. We would book this hotel again provided we could circumvent having to pay those extremely high prices for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Misleading”
Reviews.Author: drewberry
Reviews.Content: Hotel is way out of the way. No shuttle or transportation available into town. Staff is polite yet mislead and misrepresented the total bill and price of the rooms. There 'mistakes' which they admitted- cost us time and money. My brother and i travelled to 4 countries over the past 2 weeks. Stayed in a variety of places from hostels to hotels and I have to say that the experience we had at this establishment was baffling and disappointing. I can assume that they don't normally practice intentionally misleading and misrepresenting there clients? I also have to wonder if the fact that we were not business clients or big spenders affected the service or lack of service we've received. I've been traveling for many years and have never felt compelled to complain or write a poor review until now. Mercure in Amsterdam thanks but no thanks

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable hotel a bit far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: lgts
Reviews.Content: Although I had made a reservation at the Novotel Amsterdam City hotel, due to renovation works they changed it for me to the Mercure. It is a modern, tall building located a bit far away from the city center, near the metro station Overamstel. The reception area, although not so big, it is nicely decorated. The staff was very helpful and did their best to fix a problem that had occured with reservation (they told me that I had reserved a room for 2 people, although I had made a reservation just for one). What is more, when I had to make some photocopies and fax them back to my country, they did it at once, without charging me a cent. My room, on the 14th floor, was large, had sufficient furniture and a nice view. One oddity was the hammer and nails photograph over the bed, nothing to complain about, just not my taste. There was a TV, with many sattelite channels, a fully equiped mini bar with reasonable prices, coffee making facilities, phone (but not direct dial). The wardrobe was really large. Talking about the bathroom, it was at reasonable size, with a bathtub and a good range of toiletries. The breakfast was really good, with a large variety and good taste. The only problem was that the breakfast room, although in a good size, was almost always full, so one may wait for some minutes before being served. Generally talking it is a nice hotel. It's not recommended for those who come for tourism, or who would like to feel the city's nightlife, as it is a bit far from center. But it's ideal for those who have to visit the RAI business district.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, spacious rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: Holidaygypsy
Reviews.Content: Very modern decor throughout and clean rooms, loved the art on the doors! The bathroom area was modern and quite trendy. We had a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel. Bad Location.”
Reviews.Author: Karxala_Portugal
Reviews.Content: Our Room was quite big, confortable but toilet was a little let down. The location is not very good. The hotel is in the outskirts of the Town and you'll miss all the action. To reach the Centre you have to either walk about 15 minutes to the nearest tram (25) for a 20 minute ride or walk 10 minutes to the metro (metro in amsterdam is mostly for reaching outskirts points). Some staff members are not very interested in pleasing you. One of them said we were not allowed breakfast even if in our voucher it said we were. In the last day we were told breakfast was included afterall. Hotel is not terrible but location is not the best. Suitable if you find a real bargain...

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, a bit out of the way though”
Reviews.Author: bloozzz
Reviews.Content: Very good value at this newly renovated hotel. The rooms were small (no problem for me), but very nice and very clean. Great shower as well. All in all, one of the better value hotels you can find in Amsterdam. The only drawback is it's location: it's not in the city centre, so you have to take the metro to get there. And it's still a five minutes walk through an abandoned part of town. (No lights, no houses). You might feel unsafe walking this part, though I don't think it really is unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly, quite good”
Reviews.Author: sat_suki44
Reviews.Content: Very clean, spacy room, friendly staff, good restaurant serving reasonally-priced nice food (hadn't expected I'd be able to enjoy that good ham steak there!). A bit far from both metro and tram stations (probably 10-15 mins walk), which might make you feel a bit more tired after walking around sightseeing. Sometimes heard a strange small noise at our room at night, not very annoying though. Overall, I liked it and would like to stay next time too :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gabriella1
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the hotel for 1 night in February 2009. The deal was excellent and our 14 year old child was free. The bedroom was very big and the teenage child had a double bed (settee/bed). Other comments say that this hotel is a long way from the centre of Amsterdam. It is 7 stops from Amsterdam's Central Station and the journet time is only a few minutes. It is then less then a 5 minute walk from Overamstel (the nearest Metro Station) to the hotel. It was a lovely hotel with good facilities and I would highly recommend it. The meals in the hotel are expensive - so were I to stay there again I would eat out of the hotel. That said, there are no obvious restaurants in the area near the hotel. The staff were very helpful and I really could not fault the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: livingthedream87
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed in a more central hotel in amsterdam, we seeked something similar. however hotels were booked and we had to settle for the mercure amstel. It is was more than 1km to the centre, it is 1km from the centre of Amstel. However as a party of 8, we flagged down 2 taxis and the price was 20euros. this meant 5euros each per trip - the cost of a beer in amsterdam. which didn't matter to us. We checked in efficiently and the staff were helpful and able to answer all of my questions. The rooms were clean, and spacious with views over the amstel river and amsterdam arena in the distance. After a night in the town, we arrived back at 12.45 am, and the bar was still open. we had a drink and a friendly chat with the barman. I retreated to my room, and had a fantastic nights sleep. the pillow was perfect and i was not disturbed at all. It was fantastic to know that check out was 12.30 latest and breakfast was served until 11. The breakfast was superb and was included in the price i got from superbreak. a pure bargain. i would deffinatly reccomend the mercure amstel, as long as your happy to take a tram or pay for a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Luciana_Barbosa
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Me and my boyfriend went to a backpack trip through Europe and being at a four stars hotel was very fine. The location is not really a problem...the metro station is only 10-minute walking far. I bet we could never find such a good hotel for the same prices in downtown. The staff is very friendly, the breakfast is good, as much as the room service. The restaurant is a little bit expensive, but offers quality food and drink. The room is totaly comfortable and clean, the shower and bathtub are superb. DonÂ´t let go for reviews which undeserve this hotel, because the metro service in Amsterdam is completely precise and nobody should die due to a 10-minute walking to the station. And when we were there, it was 3ÂºC!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GB73
Reviews.Content: Pro: The hotel is nice and clean. The staff was helpful. The breakfast was good, being an American I like a hot breakfast. The breakfast buffet had scrambled eggs, bacon, wonderful croissants, fresh squeezed orange juice, fresh fruit, and few other items. The breakfast buffet also had the typically European breakfast, cold meats and cheese, fish, bread, tea, coffee, and what you expect from an European breakfast. The metro stop about 10 min walk from the hotel(with a stroller). Go out the front door turn left. You can buy the tickets at the front desk. Con: No where to eat around the hotel. It is located in an industrial area. Have breakfast at the hotel, but make sure you eat before returning to the hotel. The hotel restaurant is expense. I did find a small snack cafe across the bridge(turn right outside of the hotel and over the bridge) that was good, but other than that the only restaurant(which was recommended by the hotel staff) required reservations. Overall: Good value, we got a special weekend rate that included the breakfast. It is on the outskirts of Amsterdam, but a short metro ride into the city. I would recommend doing a hop on and hop off canal bus in Amsterdam. Pick up Rick Steves travel guide for Amsterdam, it was very helpful. If you plan on seeing the Anne Frank house, do it an hour or 2 before it closes. The line during the day is really long, but we went about 90 minutes before it closed very few poeple in line, less than a 10 min wait.

Reviews.Title: “Far from city center”
Reviews.Author: NatalieGreece
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 days. The room was very good and clean and the staff very friendly and helpful in every way, the breakfast boufet was not very big but it was clean and tasty. The only problem with this hotel is that its far from city center. The nearest station is walking 15 minutes and tacking the tram for 20 minutes to get to the city center (Dam square or Central Station). Otherwise everything was great from

Reviews.Title: “Good room & breakfast away from centre”
Reviews.Author: LucyCarvalho
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at this hotel over the bank holiday weekend following the great reviews this property has received. We live in London and love walking so therefore did not think its location away from the centre to be of concern. The room was quiet, clean with good quality toilettries, the breakfast was very good (a lot to choose from). However t the hotel staff, both at breakfast room and reception were almost indiferent to their guests and were not able to cope with basic demands such as the provision of hot water for making tea. Another disappointment was the "Fitness Centre" - a small room with 3 fitness machines badly serviced and a broken table football. Next time we will stay somewhere else,

Reviews.Title: “Corporate, expensive but friendly”
Reviews.Author: ADL
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 11th floor - the air conditioning worked but did not cool down the room enough so was a bit dissapointed. This is a good business hotel - restaurant and bar are expensive. Hotel is a way from town so a taxi costs 12 to 15 Euros into town. Staff were friendly though and there were no problems or suprises.

Reviews.Title: “Tulip in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: JoWilson
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with 12 university students. We were put on a floor on our own (which meant that they couldn't disturb anyone!) The accommodation was very good and beat the usual backpacking accommodation I have used before in Amsterdam. Breakfast was fine and fresh. The drinks were expensive but the food was good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Not a destination hotel, but convenient for business purposes”
Reviews.Author: Jerri_Blank
Reviews.Content: Had a standard room, a nice view of the Amstel and the Amsterdam ArenA. It's a brief walk to the tram line, about a 15-20 minute walk to the RAI. Room was nothing special. I was hoping for a large bed, but just two twin-size beds shoved together. Shower was good, very strong water pressure, although I did overhear some people complaining that their rooms had no water pressure. Breakfast was lacking, just scrambled eggs and breads basically - not much variety. Staff was all very friendly. Can be difficult to get a taxi here. Overall, I would stay here again if I needed to but certainly wouldn't go out of my way for it. It is nothing special. Definitely not a tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great breakfast ... a little far out.”
Reviews.Author: adnelg
Reviews.Content: We just finished up a four-night stay here. It was overall a fantastic experience. We arrived fresh off our transatlantic flight at 06:00, and the hotel was kind enough to let us check in 8 hours early and snooze off our jet lag. In addition, they were more than welcoming, encouraging us to come back for directions and more information if there was anything that we forgot in our sleepy state. The room was very clean with a comfortable bed and a clean, large bathroom. We did upgrade to the club room, so I'm not sure whether this impacted the size of our room, but I have to say that it was very large by European standards. The included breakfast was a great way to start the day: eggs, meat, toast, cereal, fruits, yogurt ... I ate more than my fair share. The only down side is that you are a bit out of the city. The tram does run close to the hotel, and you can't miss your stop at the end of the line (helpful after the coffehouse), but it's about a 5 minute walk from the tram to the hotel over a bridge. It was a little frustrating having to abide by the tram schedule while on vacation, but I think overall worthwhile to get to stay in such a great place. I should mention that in any other downtown, a hotel this distance from city centre would still be well within the limits of downtown, it's just that Amsterdam's downtown core and therefore, what would be downtown still in London or Paris feels a little further out here.

Reviews.Title: “superb location to quickly get to know the city!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although my wife and I stayed only three nights we strongly felt we could not have chosen a more appropriate hotel. If, like us, you wish to explore the city for yourself, then walk out the hotel's front door, turn right, follow the main road (on foot) across a busy bridge and in ten minutes you'll be at the no. 25 tram terminus. A frequent (10 minute) service takes you to Central Station in 15-20 minutes! A two day travel pass (purchase at hotel reception for 10 Euros!) gives unlimited travel on all buses, trams and Metros for 48 hours from time of first use. The public transport system in Amsterdam is excellent --- you can easily reach any destination you seek. If the weather is poor, see the city by tram! The no 25 passes the canal tours. Everybody in Amsterdam speaks English! The hotel rooms are excellent, comfortable and the hotel staff could not be better; any request is promptly dealt with. The bathroom is tops, everything you hope for is provided. Restaurant is equally excellent (perhaps a little expensive?); breakfast is enormous "help-yourself", lots of fruit, drinks and well cooked eggs, bacon etc. Everything is immaculately clean, catering staff keep the tables spotless, with immediacy. On days of departure, automatic 'phone service awakens those departing. TVs in the rooms easily pick up BBC TV stations for those who like to watch English TV before bed!

Reviews.Title: “Above average, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: shadow2x
Reviews.Content: For a European hotel, this hotel was quite comfortable and spacious. The rooms are very nicely decorated with and the beds are very comfortable to sleep in. There aren't many restaurants nearby or activities, as the main city is somewhat of a drive away, but the hotel itself was clean, affordable, and quiet. The breakfast the hotel offered was excellent. They have this interesting machine that squeezes out fresh orange juice for you, which tasted really good. There was lots of choices for breakfast food as well. I would definitely go back here if I was looking for a good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too too far out”
Reviews.Author: HP14
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Aan de Amstel is a hotel that you stay in because you have to be in the area, not because you choose to go there. Its huge plus is the excellent staff, in particular on reception, but in general throughout the hotel staff are very good: I was very impressed. Overall the hotel was very clean and well kept, the room I had was rather small but adequate for one person. Room service breakfast was good â€“ only drawback was the price - â‚¬17.50, and this is the only breakfast the hotel offers (but Iâ€™d got a good room rate so overall it was still reasonable). The big downside is however the location â€“ even if you are staying here as you have business in the area (and Iâ€™m not sure why else you would, there must be other hotels of similar quality closer to the centre of Amsterdam) itâ€™s a long way out. The hotel bar/restaurant is not an ideal place to unwind and, given the option, rather than travel into town in the evening, if there were a next time, I think Iâ€™d rather stay in the centre and travel out in the morning rather than travel in to town in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms are the only kind words I can muster”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To preface, we got what we deserved after arriving in Amsterdam late on a Saturday night. I normally stay at the Sofitel near Centraal Station but along with every other conveniently located hotel it was booked. They sent me to another Accor property, the Mercure. First, this hotel should not be considered to be in Amsterdam. It is completely out of the way and requires a solid 15 minute cab ride to get anywhere worth spending time in town. The night bells were both broken and along with 6 other guests it took us 20 minutes just to get into the lobby at about 2 am, Sunday morning. The desk clerk then had the gall to argue in 2 languages with us-everyone was irate. Although a canal city there were mice running all around outside the front door area where 2 overflowing garbage pails sat. Yuck. The rooms are nicely decorated and good sized but the king bed is actually 2 singles pushed together on rollers...so be careful...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: TravelSchmavel
Reviews.Content: Like the previous reviewer, I stayed here for a conference at the RAI. It appeared from the map that it was walkable, but it was actually quite far...about 35 minutes. Pros: - The hotel itself was quite nice, the breakfast buffet had an excellent selection - Clean rooms, nice view of the Amstel (ask for a view) - For European standards, the rooms were spacious, work desk, sparkling bathroom - Room service is quick and fine - Pleasant staff and very helpful, everyone speaks English Cons: - Being a business traveler, I used the wireless Internet and it cost 30 Euros/day or 99/Euros/week. Quite expensive and there is no printer on site. - No iron in the room, you must ask for one, but maid service only at certain times - Distance...20 minute walk to the nearest tram stop (#4 to Central Station), 35 minutes to the RAI. Would be great if you are on a bike, has very accessible bike lanes. Overall a good value for great quality if you don't mind the walk or have other transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel but too far out of town”
Reviews.Author: scruffty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July 2005 whilst attending the Microsft TechEd Conference at the RAI Conference Centre. We were led to believe that it was close to the RAI - it isn't! There is no easy way to get public transport there, and it took us 20 minutes to walk it. It was also a 5 - 10 minute walk to the nearest tram, number 25. The tram took about 20 minutes to reach the Dam and the last tram was about 00:15. It was, however a pleasant walk over a canal, with lots of wildlife such as ducks, birds etc and some picturesque house boats, views etc. Onto the hotel, it feels very modern downstairs in the lobby, reception and restaurant. The food was pretty good, but was a tad pricey (typical hotel prices) and the portions were of inconsitant size - one night loads of food, the next night, not as big, but this wasn't a problem...maybe they were being generous one night?! Breakfast was nice with lots of variety, but again, was pricey. The room was of a fair size, but the bathroom needed modernisation, although it sufficed. The bed was comfortable, as were the pillows. The hotel is of a confusing layout with two towers, only accessible from their own lifts. I'm not a bif fan of lifts, and could only walk to the first floor - you have to get a lift for the others. Don't worry though, there are adequate fire escapes, it's just that they go straight outside! The staff were friendly enough. Overall, it was alright, but too far out of town. If you can get a good deal here (with Breakfast included) and don't mind getting the tram to the centre, then go for it - you won't be that disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: enzozoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of december 2003. The hotel is really beautiful,the staff is friendly, breakfast is wide and of good quality. The breakfast room is absulotely beautiful and classy. The room was not so wide but had space enough. Hotel location: certainly is out of city centre, but is very easy and fast to go to city center because of the number 51 tram, 5 minutes walk to the hotel, and there is also a metro stop very close to the hotel (approx. 5 min walk). It takes 10-15 minutes to Dam Square. We had a great time. Don't listen to the only bad rewiev! RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facilities - Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous review the evening before travelling, I was filled with concern. The review could not be more wrong in our experience. The standard of hotel is very good. As experienced Hilton regulars, we found this hotel to be of an even higher standard. The food, both in the Bistro and at breakfast, was the best we have had in a business class hotel. There was a pleasant ambiance in the bar area and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. The room was perfect with plenty of space and every facility you require. Cleanliness standards were excellent. The regular Metro service is at the bottom of the street (approx 1/2 mile) and very efficient. We were in a rush to get there the first day and paid 22 Euros in a taxi from the centre, but the Metro is only 2.40. We had a very pleasant weekend there and were glad to leave the centre of town to escape to our very comfortable hotel at night. I would imagine the hotel is busy with business travellers during the week, the conference facilities were excellent, but it was paced just right at the weekend. I do not understand how anyone could complain about this hotel. If you have already booked, I would like to ease your worry and assure you that you will enjoy a pleasant stay. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Not for tourists!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is far away from the old city, you need a taxi ans that is hard to find and very expensive from this hotel. The view from my room was on a dirty industial area. Not really what you expect from a visit to Amsterdam. Staff is extreme unfriendly when you have any comments about the not working airco or the empty minibar. After 09.30 it is impossible to get some food and in the isolated area of the hotel there are no restaurants or shops. Try to book a hotel n the city centre when you visit Amsterdam.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Hotel Amsterdam Aan de Amstel
HotelInfo.Address: Joan Muyskenweg 10, Amsterdam 1096 CJ, The Netherlands
